title: Marketing Core Doctrine (CKR)
brand_doctrine: Real jobsite photos only. Before/after preferred.
No fabricated reviews, licences, or warranties.
Warranty language is realistic and expressed as a range unless job-specific.
inspection_doctrine: Inspect first (on-roof where safe and accessible).
Recommend only what the roof genuinely needs.
Write a photo-backed scope the client can keep.

typical_enquiry_triggers: Roof looks tired from the street
Not sure if the roof is fine or failing
Ceiling stain or dripping after rain
Buying or selling and want clarity

photos_minimum: Wide shots of all roof planes (front, rear, sides)
Any active leak evidence where accessible
notes_minimum: Defect list with severity (urgent, soon, monitor)

exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Plumbing leaks and HVAC leaks
Internal condensation diagnosis beyond roof interface
Structural engineering decisions beyond roofing scope

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Can you quote from the ground?
common_objections_and_responses.response: Accurate scopes require on-roof photos. Ground quoting increases guesswork and disputes.

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Are you just going to recommend a restoration?
common_objections_and_responses.response: Outcomes range from no work required to full restoration. Photos and condition decide.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Uncertainty and worry about what is really happening on the roof.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Clarity with photos, plain-English explanation, and a written scope you can keep.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: Only recommend work that addresses documented defects
Explicitly state 'monitor only' when no work is required

services.definition_locked: Full roof restoration always includes painting. If there is no painting, it is not a full restoration.
variations: Partial restoration (repairs + stabilisation only, no paint)
suitable_roof_types: Structurally sound tiled roofs with repairable defects
Metal roofs with repairable surface issues (chalking, minor corrosion)
Roofs where replacement is not the appropriate outcome
typical_enquiry_triggers: Moss, lichen, staining, and heavy surface ageing
Loose ridge caps or failing pointing

photos_minimum: Post-clean prep state (surface ready for coating)
After wide shots and detail shots
notes_minimum: Coating system used (product tier, primer, coats)

safety_constraints_high_level: Fall risk and slip risk managed via professional controls
Work windows depend on weather and roof condition
exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Asbestos roof restoration (refer to licensed removal and re-roof pathway)
Major structural timber failure (refer builder/carpenter/engineer)
End-of-life substrates where restoration is false economy (recommend re-roof)

common_objections_and_responses.response: Painting without correct preparation is not restoration. Prep controls adhesion and longevity.
Sequence controls adhesion and water tightness. Each stage is photo-documented.
Recommendations are condition-based. Repairs-only and partial scopes exist where suitable.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Aged, inconsistent finish and higher risk at known weak points.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Sealed and protected roof with a uniform finish and documented proof of work.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: Gutter clean recommended when roof debris will load gutters
Valley replacement only when corrosion/defect is documented
Painting is not offered as an add-on to repairs-only scopes unless a full restoration is the correct outcome
locked_restoration_sequence_for_tiled_ro: Cleaning second (high-pressure or soft wash based on condition)
Repointing last for adhesion to a clean surface

services.canonical_service_name: Roof Painting / Coatings (Industrial Roof Coating Systems)
suitable_roof_types: Sound tile or metal roofs after correct preparation
Roofs where adhesion conditions can be met
typical_enquiry_triggers: Protection layer as part of full restoration

notes_minimum: Product system used (Roof Refresh, Roof Protect, or 20-Year Roof Protect)
Colour and batch details where available

safety_constraints_high_level: Weather windows required for coating performance
exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Painting over failed bedding/pointing
Painting as substitute for structural repair
Painting end-of-life substrates where re-roof is required

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Will it peel or fade quickly?
common_objections_and_responses.response: Longevity depends on preparation and system selection. We document prep and coat stages.

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Can you warranty it for 20 years no matter what?
common_objections_and_responses.response: Warranty depends on product system and roof suitability. We use realistic ranges and manufacturer terms.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Faded, chalky, patchy roof surface and reduced street appeal.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Uniform protective membrane finish with documented coating system and proof photos.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: Only offer coating when roof condition supports adhesion
If substrate is failing, recommend re-roof rather than coating

services.canonical_service_name: High-Pressure Washing / Soft Washing / Moss Treatment
variations: High-pressure cleaning up to 4000 PSI where suitable
Soft wash where pressure is unsuitable
suitable_roof_types: Terracotta tiles (often soft wash depending on condition)

photos_minimum: Before and after roof plane shots
notes_minimum: Method chosen and why (pressure vs soft wash)

safety_constraints_high_level: Slip risk on wet roof surfaces
Fall risk managed via professional controls
Water ingress risk managed by technique and method selection
exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Asbestos surfaces (do not disturb; refer licensed specialists)
Extremely fragile heritage substrates may require specialist

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Will high-pressure push water into the house?
common_objections_and_responses.response: Method is chosen based on roof condition. Soft wash is used when needed.
Growth can return. Treatment helps delay regrowth. Results vary by environment.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Heavy growth and staining hides defects and ages the whole house visually.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Clean surface, defects visible for honest assessment, improved water flow.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: If cleaning reveals defects, document and recommend targeted repairs
No automatic upsell to painting

variations: Repoint only where bedding is sound
Rebedding + repoint where bedding has failed
safety_constraints_high_level: High fall risk at roof apex
exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Structural ridge beam or roof framing issues (refer builder/carpenter)

common_objections_and_responses.response: Ridge failure is a storm risk. Stabilisation is preventative maintenance.

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Can you just patch the cracks?
common_objections_and_responses.response: Patch-only fails when bedding is loose. We rebed where required.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Cracking, movement, and storm vulnerability along the roof spine.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Secure ridges, clean lines, and sealed junctions.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: Cleaning recommended before repoint where contamination prevents adhesion
Painting only when a full restoration is the correct outcome

variations: Valley width upgrade where capacity is an issue
suitable_roof_types: Metal roofs with valley flashings (scope dependent)
exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Heritage copper or lead valleys may require specialist
Major structural valley board rot beyond minor repair

common_objections_and_responses.response: Sealants are temporary when metal is perforated. Replacement restores function.

common_objections_and_responses.objection: It only leaks in heavy rain
common_objections_and_responses.response: Heavy rain is the proof load case. Fix prevents ceiling damage.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Hidden weak link with elevated leak risk.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Restored drainage and water tightness along internal roof lines.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: If valley outlet is blocked, recommend gutter clean
If adjacent tiles are fragile, recommend limited replacements with proof

variations: Optional gutter guard education (no maintenance-free claims)
suitable_roof_types: All homes with gutters, access dependent
exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Full gutter replacement (refer as required)
Underground stormwater drainage blockages (refer plumber)

common_objections_and_responses.response: Guards can reduce load but do not eliminate maintenance.
Partial blockages still cause overflow in heavy rain.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Overflow risk and avoidable water damage risk at eaves and fascia.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Free flow, reduced stress on roof drainage system.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: If roof is heavily loaded with debris, suggest roof clean
If gutters are rusted through, refer to replacement

notes_minimum: Next steps if further work is required

exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Plumbing leaks and HVAC leaks
Internal condensation causes beyond roof interface

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Can you guarantee it is fixed in one visit?
common_objections_and_responses.response: Complex leaks can be iterative. We document findings and resolve what is identifiable.

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Another roofer could not find it
common_objections_and_responses.response: We run a proof-led process and show the cause with photos where possible.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Frustration and uncertainty about the real cause.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Root cause identified with evidence and a clear fix pathway.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: Recommend broader inspection only when evidence indicates wider ageing
Do not jump to restoration unless condition supports it

variations: Temporary protection where matching is delayed
exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Widespread tile failure approaching end-of-life (recommend restoration or re-roof)

common_objections_and_responses.response: One crack can cause water ingress. Replacement prevents ceiling damage.
Matching depends on availability. Function first. Best match sourced where possible.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Water ingress risk at a single point in the roof envelope.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Roof envelope restored at that point with photo proof.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: If multiple cracks are present, recommend a roof audit scope
If ridge failure contributes, recommend ridge stabilisation

suitable_roof_types: Asbestos re-roof pathway via licensed removal
typical_enquiry_triggers: Storm or hail damage beyond repair
exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Major structural redesign (refer builder/engineer)
Asbestos removal must be licensed and compliant

common_objections_and_responses.response: If substrate is failing, restoration is false economy. Re-roof is the durable choice.

common_objections_and_responses.objection: What if it rains during the job?
common_objections_and_responses.response: Work is planned in sections with mandatory protection and weather windows.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Ongoing risk and repeated costs on a failing roof.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Reset roof lifecycle with documented install and clear warranty path.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: Consider gutters where appropriate to complete drainage outcomes
Provide insulation and ventilation advice as education, not a hard sell

notes_minimum: Compliance and warranty docs as applicable

exclusions_and_referral_boundaries: Design engineering and major structural alterations beyond roofing
Solar installation is coordinated or referred, not claimed as roofing

common_objections_and_responses.response: Compare inclusions, compliance, documentation, and warranty clarity, not just price.

common_objections_and_responses.objection: Will it match the existing roof?
common_objections_and_responses.response: Best match sourcing is used. Weathering differences are explained.

outcome_framing_before_after.before: Open structure and project exposure to weather.
outcome_framing_before_after.after: Dried-in, protected structure with clean roofline and documentation.

ethical_cross_sell_logic: Only suggest upgrades that materially reduce risk or improve durability
Avoid package language and avoid unnecessary add-ons

finish.colour_range: Limited palette of common roof shades

notes: Warranty is conditional on correct system and roof suitability
Previously painted roofs may be excluded from product warranty

notes: Conditional on correct system and roof suitability
Excludes extreme events and improper application

Contains UV inhibitors and infrared reflectors (product-described)

rules: Never claim 'Melbourne-wide' unless factually accurate for current capacity and travel policy.
assumptions: Suburb lists are best-effort and non-exhaustive.
Zones are measured from Clyde North and may vary by travel time.

principles: Use fewer tags rather than spam blocks.

operational_rules.banned_restricted_warning: Banned and restricted hashtags change. Check before posting.

hashtag_packs.name: Pre-Sale Ready
hashtag_packs.use_case: Vendors and agents preparing for listing

minimum_photo_set_per_job: Two junction photos (ridge and valley or flashing)

service_specific_minimums.Ridge work: Before and after ridge line close-ups
service_specific_minimums.Valley replacement: Old valley condition + install stage photos
service_specific_minimums.Coatings: Post-clean prep + primer + final finish photos

minimum_notes_on_site: Roof type and estimated age (ASSUMPTION if unknown)
Defect list with severity (urgent, soon, monitor)
Outcome recommendation logic (why this scope, why not more)
acceptable_caption_inputs: Proof points (photos, stage shots, scope logic)
Warranty language as a range unless product-specific
standard_disclaimers: Inspection required before quoting and before recommending scope.
Warranty depends on system and products used, and correct preparation.
Product warranties are subject to manufacturer terms and roof suitability.

format_rules: Short paragraphs (max 3 lines) in client-facing outputs
Clear headings and numbered lists in doctrine outputs
hard_rules: No pricing unless explicitly supplied by the user (otherwise mark ASSUMPTION).
No fabricated reviews, licences, or warranties.
